title: Deploy Nodes in 60s: Sumbu NodeOS for Coolify
summary: Deploying a Cardano node is too hard. It requires advanced Linux skills, days of syncing, and complex maintenance. This high barrier forces developers to use centralized APIs or quit entirely.
solution: A "One-Click" Coolify template that deploys a full Cardano Stack (Node, Ogmios, Hydra) + a custom Web Dashboard for easy management, backed by Sumbu Labs support.
proposer_relevant_experience:
**Sumbu Labs** is a verified builder entity incubated at Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM), Indonesia’s premier research university. We are not a new team; we are the **Fund 13 Winners \(60,000 ADA\)** who delivered the **CAR\-dano** protocol.

# Core Team & Verifiable Achievements
1. **Giga Hidjrika Aura Adkhy \(Project Lead\):**

    2. Proof: Featured in Official UGM News ([https://ugm\.ac\.id/en/news/ugm\-students\-and\-alumni\-develop\-blockchain\-based\-used\-car\-inspection\-platform/\)](https://ugm.ac.id/en/news/ugm-students-and-alumni-develop-blockchain-based-used-car-inspection-platform/)) for leading the first blockchain-based car inspection pilot in Indonesia.

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Currently, running a Cardano Node requires one of two extremes: paying high fees for managed APIs (Blockfrost) or possessing deep DevOps skills to configure bare-metal Linux servers. There is no middle ground.



Sumbu NodeOS innovates by bridging this gap using **Coolify**, the fastest-growing open-source PaaS.

1. **Platform Native**: Unlike existing scripts (Guild Operators) which are CLI-based, our solution is GUI-first. It lives inside the Coolify interface developers already use.
2. **The "Sumbu Dashboard"**: We aren't just providing a config file. We are building a custom React-based sidecar app that runs alongside the node. This innovative dashboard visualizes "invisible" data (Mempool saturation, Sync status) and provides "One-Click Actions" (Vacuum DB, Restart) that usually require SSH access.
3. **Mithril Speed**: We innovate on speed by auto-injecting Mithril snapshots, reducing sync time from days to minutes.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
We will deliver a working Alpha Release in Month 2. The MVP will be a public GitHub repository containing the service.json templates and Docker containers.



Users will be able to demonstrate:

1. **Installation**: Opening a fresh Coolify instance, adding the "Sumbu Source," and clicking "Deploy Cardano Stack."
2. **Operation**: Accessing [https://node\.your\-domain\.com](https://node.your-domain.com) to see the Sumbu Dashboard GUI.
3. **API Access:** Successfully sending a request to the bundled Ogmios endpoint to query the blockchain tip.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
We define success not just by "downloads," but by the Economic Value of developer time saved and the Stability of the infrastructure deployed. We track this across three horizons:

1. **Adoption & Usage \(The "Volume" Metric\)**
    1. Target: 200+ Verified Docker Pulls of the Sumbu NodeOS images in the first 6 months after launch.
    2. Why this is realistic: There are ~2,000 active projects building on Cardano. Capturing 10% of the active market (plus new students) is an ambitious but achievable target for a "One-Click" solution.
    3. Measurement: Public Docker Hub pull statistics and GitHub "Clone" traffic logs.
2. **Product Retention \(The "Stickiness" Metric\)**
    1. Target: 50+ Long-Running Nodes (Active >30 Days).
    2. Why this justifies the budget: Many tools get downloaded and deleted. A "Long-Running Node" proves that a developer is actually building on our stack.
    3. Measurement: We will add an opt-in telemetry "Heartbeat" to the Sumbu Dashboard. This allows us to report: "53 Nodes are currently live and syncing on Mainnet using Sumbu NodeOS." This is the ultimate proof of utility.
3. **Infrastructure Velocity \(The "ROI" Metric\)**
    1. Target: Reduce the average "Time-to-Sync" from 48 hours (standard) to <30 minutes (Sumbu + Mithril).
    2. The Economic Calculation (Value for Money):
        1. If 50 developers save 2 days (16 work hours) each:
            1. 50 Devs * 16 Hours * $50/hr (Avg Rate) = $40,000 USD Saved.
            2. This explicitly covers the ~100,000 ADA budget request. The ecosystem breaks even with just 50 active users.
    3. Measurement: A side-by-side video benchmark ("Traditional Setup vs. Sumbu Setup") published on YouTube to prove the speed claim.
4. **Community Validation \(The "Trust" Metric\)**
    1. Target: 30+ GitHub Stars and inclusion in the Official Coolify Templates Registry.
    2. Why this matters: Getting merged into the official Coolify repository means our tool becomes available to their 20,000+ global users, exposing Cardano to a massive Web2 audience for free.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
The "Hello World" of Cardano development is painfully difficult. To run a dApp, you need a node. To run a node, you need to understand Linux systemd, firewall rules, Docker networking, and topology files. This friction kills developer adoption.



**The Solution: Sumbu NodeOS**

We are building the **"Vercel experience"** for Cardano Infrastructure.

1. **The Stack**: We package Cardano Node, Ogmios (Interface), Kupo (Indexer), and Hydra (L2) into a cohesive Docker Compose stack optimized for Coolify.
2. **The Interface**: We develop the Sumbu Dashboard, a lightweight web GUI acting as the control center. It connects to the node's internal EKG ports to visualize health.
3. **The Maintenance**: Sumbu Labs commits to an LTS (Long Term Support) model. When a Hard Fork occurs, we push updated Docker images, ensuring the user's node never goes stale.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
1. **Stopping the "Developer Churn" \(The Core Impact\)**
    1. Currently, Cardano has a massive "leaky funnel." A talented Web2 developer (accustomed to Vercel/Netlify) who wants to try Cardano is immediately hit with a 48-hour DevOps wall: syncing a node, configuring systemd, and managing topology files.
    2. The Reality: 90% of them give up or rely on centralized APIs (creating central points of failure).
    3. The Sumbu Solution: We remove this friction entirely. By integrating with Coolify (the industry-standard open-source PaaS used by 6,000+ organizations), we allow developers to deploy a sovereign, enterprise-grade Cardano Node in 60 seconds. We turn a "2-day headache" into a "1-click action," drastically increasing the conversion rate of curious Web2 devs into active Cardano builders.
2. **Decentralizing the Network at the Edge**
    1. Most dApps today rely on 2-3 massive API providers (Blockfrost/Maestro). If they go down, the dApp goes down.
    2. Our Impact: Sumbu NodeOS democratizes infrastructure. By making self-hosting as easy as clicking "Deploy," we empower thousands of small dApps, stake pools, and students to run their own nodes. This creates a more resilient, censorship-resistant network where "Host Your Own" is the default, not the exception.
3. **Accelerating "Real World" Adoption \(RWA\)** 
    1. As an RWA-focused lab (Ototentik), we know that real-world businesses (like logistics companies) cannot use public APIs for sensitive data; they must self-host.
    2. The Bridge: Our solution provides the "Enterprise Starter Pack" for non-crypto businesses. A traditional IT Manager can deploy Sumbu NodeOS on their existing private cloud (AWS/Azure) without needing to hire a specialized Blockchain Engineer, saving the ecosystem millions in "integration costs."

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
**Sumbu Labs** is an entity incubated by students and alumni of Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM), one of Indonesia's top universities. The team has a verifiable history of delivering complex blockchain and AI solutions, notably CAR-dano (Ototentik), which was covered in official UGM news outlets.



**Why we are capable:**



1. **Proven Delivery:** This core team successfully architected and launched the MVP for CAR-dano, a blockchain-based vehicle inspection platform. We have experience managing "Real World Asset" data and creating user-friendly dApps.
2. **Academic & Technical Rigor**:
    1. **Giga Hidjrika Aura Adkhy \(Lead\)**: Has led multiple tech innovations, including UGM-AICare (AI Mental Health with EDU Chain Integration) and CAR-dano (blockchain inspection records), proving capability in managing complex, multi-disciplinary technical projects.
    2. **Maulana Anjari \(DevOps/Backend\)**: A specialized Blockchain Engineer with published research on **Hyperledger Fabric interoperability**, proving deep competence in distributed systems (the core requirement for Sumbu NodeOS).
3. **Cross\-Functional Expertise**: Unlike typical "Dev-only" teams, Sumbu Labs integrates engineering with Kanrei Engineering (Emotional Design) and Psychology-based User Research.
    1. **Azfar Azdi \(UI Designer\)**: Applies engineering-led design principles (Zenith GCS, EyeMov) to create complex dashboards that remain intuitive.
    2. **Virna Amrita \(UX Researcher\)**: A UGM Faculty Member (Psychology) who advises on User Research and Human Factors, ensuring our "One-Click" claims are validated by real user testing, not just developer intuition.

sub_fields.title: Project Milestones
sub_fields.description: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?

sub_fields.title: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?
sub_fields.description: The number of milestones required depends on the amount of funding requested. Please refer to the Guidance card on the right for details

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Core Engineering & Alpha Release

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
1. **Docker Registry:** Public Docker Hub repository sumbu-labs/cardano-node containing multi-arch (AMD64/ARM64) images for:
    1. Cardano Node (v10.5.3 or latest stable)
    2. Ogmios (v6.13.0)
    3. Kupo (v2.11.0)
2. **Orchestration Logic:** A production-ready docker-compose.yml file that defines internal networking (IPC sockets), volume persistence (/ipc, /db), and health checks.
3. **Documentation:** A README.md file detailing manual deployment steps on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. **Container Health:** Running docker compose up -d results in 3 healthy containers (cardano-node, ogmios, kupo) with status Up (healthy).
2. **API Availability:**
    1. curl localhost:1337/health returns HTTP 200 and { "networkSynchronization": 0.99... } (Ogmios).
    2. curl localhost:1442/health returns HTTP 200 (Kupo).
3. **Architecture Check:** The images successfully pull and run on both x86_64 (Standard VPS) and aarch64 (Ampere/Mac M2) architectures.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. **GitHub Repo Link:** URL to the public repository containing the source Dockerfiles.
2. **Video Demo:** A screen recording showing a clean server deployment: cloning the repo, running the compose command, and verifying the API endpoints via curl.
3. **Docker Hub Link:** URL to the published image tags.

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Sumbu Dashboard Beta (GUI)

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
1. **Frontend App:** A Next.js 15 application (sumbu-dashboard) containerized and added to the Docker stack.
2. **Backend Integration:** API routes that bridge the Dashboard frontend to the Node's internal EKG (Port 12788) and Prometheus (Port 12798) metrics.
3. **Control Features:** Implementation of "Action Buttons" that trigger privileged Docker commands via a protected internal socket (e.g., Restart Node).

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. **Visual **Metrics: The Dashboard UI at http://localhost:3000 accurately displays:
    1. Current Epoch / Block Height.
    2. Peer Count (Live data from EKG).
    3. Mempool Size (Bytes).
2. **Interactive Control:** Clicking the "Vacuum Database" button in the UI triggers the vacuum command in the PostgreSQL container (verified via container logs).
3. **Responsiveness:** The UI renders correctly on both Desktop and Mobile viewports.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. **Source Code:** GitHub link to the dashboard/ directory.
2. **Integration Video:** A video demonstrating the UI updating in real-time as the node syncs, and the "Restart" button successfully restarting the cardano-node container.

sub_fields.description: The month when this milestone will be delivered

sub_fields.title: Cost
sub_fields.description: The cost of this milestone in ADA

sub_fields.title: Progress
sub_fields.description: Current status of the milestone

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Coolify Integration & Public Beta Launch

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
1. **Coolify Templates:** A valid service.json file following Coolify's Community Template structure, including environment variable definitions (NETWORK, MITHRIL_SNAPSHOT).
2. **Mithril Integration:** A custom entrypoint script (init.sh) that checks for an empty DB, downloads the latest Mithril Mainnet snapshot (v2543.1-hotfix), and extracts it before the Node service starts.
3. **Beta Report:** A PDF report aggregating feedback from 10 pilot users (SPOs or Devs).

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. **One\-Click Deploy**: Importing the JSON template into a clean Coolify instance deploys the full stack without manual config editing.
2. **Speed Test:** The node transitions from "Starting" to "Synced" (Tip < 20 mins behind) within 45 minutes of deployment, verified by cardano-cli query tip.
3. **Stability:** The beta testing group reports a >90% success rate on deployment.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. **Template Link**: URL to the coolify-templates/ directory in the repo.
2. **Benchmark Video:** A timelapse video showing the "Deploy" click and the subsequent "Synced" status achieved under 45 minutes.
3. **Beta Feedback PDF:** Document containing anonymized user feedback and bug reports.

2. **Maulana Anjari Anggorokasih \(Lead Blockchain Engineer\)**:
    1. Credential: Researcher in Hyperledger Fabric interoperability for healthcare data.
    2. Proof: His backend architecture for CAR-dano successfully handled thousands of immutable inspection records (See: Maulana's Portfolio/Research [[https://www\.maulanaanjari\.tech](https://www.maulanaanjari.tech)]).
    3. Role: Architecting the Docker orchestration and Coolify template logic.
    4. LinkedIn: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/maulana\-anjari\-anggorokasih/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/maulana-anjari-anggorokasih/)
    5. Website: [https://maulana\.sumbu\.xyz](https://maulana.sumbu.xyz)
    6. GitHub: [https://github\.com/Maulana\-anjari](https://github.com/Maulana-anjari) 
3. **Farhan Franaka \(Lead Frontend & Dashboard\):**
    1. Credential: Core contributor to CAR-dano’s user interface.
    2. Proof: Listed as key engineer in the UGM Press Release ([https://ugm\.ac\.id/id/berita/mahasiswa\-dan\-alumni\-ugm\-kembangkan\-platform\-inspeksi\-mobil\-bekas\-berbasis\-blockchain](https://ugm.ac.id/id/berita/mahasiswa-dan-alumni-ugm-kembangkan-platform-inspeksi-mobil-bekas-berbasis-blockchain)).
    3. Role: Developing the React/Next.js "Sumbu Dashboard" for visual node management.
    4. LinkedIn: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/farhanfranaka/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/farhanfranaka/)
    5. Website: [https://frhnn\.my\.id](https://frhnn.my.id)
    6. GitHub: [https://github\.com/frhnfrnk](https://github.com/frhnfrnk) 
4. **Dzikran Azka Sajidan \(Integration Engineer\):**
    1. Credential: Computer Science Scholar (UGM '23) and Mobile Lead for CAR-dano.
    2. Role: Ensuring the Sumbu Dashboard API connects seamlessly with the Node’s internal EKG/Prometheus ports.
    3. LinkedIn: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/dzikranazkasajidan/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dzikranazkasajidan/)
    4. Website: [https://dzikran\.sumbu\.xyz](https://dzikran.sumbu.xyz)
    5. GitHub: [https://github\.com/SjdnDzikran](https://github.com/SjdnDzikran) 
5. **Azfar Azdi Arfakhsyad \(UI Designer\):**
    1. Credential: Engineering-led designer who built the inspection interface for PT Inspeksi Mobil Jogja.
    2. Role: Designing the "One-Click" deployment flow to ensure it is intuitive for non-technical users.
    3. LinkedIn: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/azfar\-azdi\-arfakhsyad\-64587a237/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/azfar-azdi-arfakhsyad-64587a237/)
    4. GitHub: [https://github\.com/Azfar101](https://github.com/Azfar101) 
6. **Virna Amrita \(UX Researcher & General Affairs\):**
    1. Credential: Faculty Member at Faculty of Psychology, UGM.
    2. Proof: UGM Faculty Profile.
    3. Role: Advising on User Experience (UX) research to ensure our documentation and dashboard reduce cognitive load for junior developers. Manages Sumbu Labs' social media.
    4. LinkedIn: [https://www\.linkedin\.com/in/virna\-amrita\-a13463261/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/virna-amrita-a13463261/)

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
1. **Core Development Team \(Labor\) \- 65,000 ADA**
- Allocated for 7 months of engineering, architecture, and design work. Rates are based on the Project Catalyst standard for "Emerging Market Elite Talent" (approx. 40-50% of US/EU rates).
    1. **Project Lead & Architect \(Giga Hidjrika\): 16,000 ADA**
        1. Rate: 75 ADA/hr x ~210 Hours total.
        2. Role: System Architecture, AI/Logic Design, Repo Maintenance, Milestone Reporting.
        3. Justification: As the architect of Ototentik, Giga commands the highest rate for managing the cross-disciplinary integration of AI, Blockchain, and UX.
    2. **Lead DevOps & Backend \(Maulana Anjari\): 14,000 ADA**
        1. Rate: 70 ADA/hr x ~200 Hours total.
        2. Role: Docker Orchestration, Coolify Template Engineering, Mithril Integration, CI/CD Pipeline.
        3. Justification: Specialized Blockchain DevOps is the scarcest skill in the ecosystem. Maulana’s Hyperledger research background justifies a premium rate for ensuring node security and stability.
    3. **Integration Engineer \(Dzikran Azka\): 11,000 ADA**
        1. Rate: 60 ADA/hr x ~183 Hours total.
        2. Role: API Development, connecting the Dashboard to Node EKG/Prometheus ports, Telemetry setup.
        3. Justification: Critical role bridging the backend Docker containers with the frontend UI.
    4. **Frontend Lead \(Farhan Franaka\): 9,500 ADA**
        1. Rate: 55 ADA/hr x ~172 Hours total.
        2. Role: Next.js Dashboard Development, State Management, Real-time Data Visualization.
        3. Justification: Senior-level frontend work required to visualize complex blockchain metrics (Mempool, Sync) in a user-friendly way.
    5. **UI/UX Designer \(Azfar Azdi\): 9,500 ADA**
        1. Rate: 55 ADA/hr x ~172 Hours total.
        2. Role: User Flow Design, Accessibility Compliance, "One-Click" Experience Optimization.
        3. Justification: Engineering-led design is crucial for infrastructure tools to prevent user error.
    6. **UX Researcher & Advisor \(Virna Amrita\): 5,000 ADA**
        1. Rate: 80 ADA/hr x ~62 Hours total (Advisory Role).
        2. Role: Human Factors Review, Usability Testing Protocols, Documentation Logic.
        3. Justification: High hourly rate for specialized academic advisory, but lower total hours as this is a guidance role.
2. **Infrastructure & Operations \- 15,000 ADA**
    1. High-Performance Bare Metal Servers: 8,000 ADA
        1. Spec: 3x Dedicated Servers (AMD Ryzen 9, 64GB RAM, 2TB NVMe) rented from Hetzner/Contabo for 12 months.
        2. Usage: CI/CD Build Server, Snapshot Mirroring, and "Canary" Nodes for testing updates before public release.
    2. Software Licenses & Tooling: 3,000 ADA
        1. Coolify Pro subscriptions, GitHub Copilot for team, Docker Hub Pro.
    3. LTS Maintenance Buffer: 4,000 ADA
        1. Reserved fund to pay for server costs post-launch (Months 8-12) to guarantee uptime for early users.
3. **Marketing & Education \- 10,000 ADA**
    1. Video Production: 5,000 ADA
        1. Professional editing for the "Zero to Node" course and "Sumbu Labs" launch trailer.
    2. Documentation Bounty: 3,000 ADA
        1. Paid technical writing to create the GitBook/Docusaurus site.
    3. Community Incentives: 2,000 ADA
        1. Micro-bounties for the first 50 Beta Testers who submit valid bug reports.
4. **Contingency & Volatility Reserve \- 10,000 ADA**
    1. Standard 10% buffer to protect against ADA price volatility or unexpected technical debt (e.g., a sudden Cardano Hard Fork requiring a code rewrite).

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
**How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano community?**

1. **Elite Talent at "Builder" Rates \(Geographic Arbitrage\)** 
    1. Sumbu Labs is based in Indonesia, allowing us to offer Senior-Level Engineering at a fraction of the cost of a US/EU team.
        1. The Math: A US-based Senior DevOps Engineer costs $150/hr. Our Lead Engineer (Maulana) is billed at ~70 ADA/hr (approx. $25-$30 USD).
        2. The Value: The Community gets 5x the engineering hours for the same budget, without sacrificing quality (verified by our academic and professional track records).
2. **Tangible Software Asset vs\. "Research"** 
    1. Many Catalyst proposals ask for 100k ADA for "Research" or "Community Building." We are delivering a Tangible Product Suite:
        1. A custom GUI Dashboard (Software).
        2. Verified Docker Images (Infrastructure).
        3. A Video Course (Education). Even if only 100 developers use Sumbu NodeOS, the cost-per-user is 1,000 ADA, a negligible price to pay for permanently onboarding a developer to the ecosystem.
3. **Infrastructure ROI \(The "Saved Time" Multiplier\)**
    1. We estimate Sumbu NodeOS will save the average developer 20 hours of setup time.
        1. If we onboard 500 developers (our conservative target):
            1. 500 Devs x 20 Hours x $50/hr (Avg Global Dev Rate) = $500,000 USD Value Created.
        2. For an investment of 100,000 ADA (~$40k USD), the Cardano ecosystem receives $500,000 in productivity value. This is a 12.5x ROI.
4. **Verified "Sumbu" Brand Security** 
    1. By funding an established entity (Fund 13 Winners), the community minimizes "Rug Pull" risk. Our team is public, verified by UGM, and has a reputation to protect. This reliability is "Value for Money" because it guarantees delivery.

sub_fields.title: I confirm that evidence of prior research, whitepaper, design, or proof-of-concept is provided.
sub_fields.description: Foundational Work:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal includes ecosystem research and uses the findings to either (a) justify its uniqueness over existing solutions or (b) demonstrate the value of its novel approach.
sub_fields.description: Ecosystem Value Proposition:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal demonstrates technical capability via verifiable in-house talent or a confirmed development partner (GitHub, LinkedIn, portfolio, etc.)
sub_fields.description: Builder Credentials:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposer and all team members are in good standing with prior Catalyst projects.
sub_fields.description: Catalyst Standing:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal clearly defines the problem and the value of the on-chain utility.
sub_fields.description: Problem & Use Case:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the primary goal of the proposal is a working prototype deployed on at least a Cardano testnet.
sub_fields.description: Tangible Prototype:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal outlines a credible and clear technical plan and architecture.
sub_fields.description: Technical Approach:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the budget and timeline (≤ 12 months) are realistic for the proposed work.
sub_fields.description: Realistic Scope:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the proposal includes a community engagement and feedback plan to amplify prototype adoption with the Cardano ecosystem.
sub_fields.description: Community Engagement:

sub_fields.title: I confirm that the budget is for future development only; excludes retroactive funding, incentives, giveaways, re-granting, or sub-treasuries.
sub_fields.description: Budget Compliance:

sub_fields.title: I Agree
sub_fields.description: I confirm that I have read, understand and shall adhere to the [Project Catalyst Platform Terms of Use](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/project-catalyst-platform-terms-of-use), [Project Catalyst Platform Privacy Policy](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/project-catalyst-platform-privacy-policy), [Terms & Conditions](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions), [Fund Rules](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/fund-rules), [Privacy Policy](https://docs.projectcatalyst.io/current-fund/fund-basics/project-catalyst-terms-and-conditions/catalyst-fc-privacy-policy). I understand that providing accurate and truthful information is essential for my proposal to remain eligible to participate in the current Fund.
